Proposed Gender Mainstreaming Activities (Target) 

Primary Responsibility 

Output 1: National roads will be upgraded and climate proofed. 

  Ensure  that  detailed  design  of  upgraded  roads  are  shared  with  local  authorities, 
Conculo de Suco, women and men members of affected households and communities 
through community consultations (at least 30% of participants are women). 

  Ensure  that  road  safety  measures  (i.e.,  lighting,  speed  humps,  warning/street  signs, 
sidewalks, crosswalks, sea  walls,  etc.),  especially  around schools,  health  centers, and 
markets are incorporated into the road design. 

  Ensure  that  resettlement  and  land  acquisition  community  meetings  involve  local 
authorities,  women  and  youth  representatives  of  Conculo  de  Suco,  women’s 
organizations/NGOs, and affected land owners (at least 30% of women participants and 
50% of female facilitators); arrange separate meetings for women if necessary. 

  Ensure  that  land  acquisition  and  compensation  process  is  transparent,  and  that 
compensation  is  disbursed  in  the  name  of  both  spouses  and/or  to  women-headed 
households/widow. 

  Assist  women  and  men  beneficiaries  of  resettlement  and  compensation  package  to 

open bank accounts, if necessary. 

  Provide  equal  opportunity  and  access  to  women  and  men  contractors  in  bidding 

process. 

  Encourage  contractors  to  prioritize  the  use  of  local  materials  and  the  employment  of 
local workers and to maximize use of women (at least 10%) in labor-based work and at 
least 25% in bio-engineering work.

Outputs and 
Activities 

Proposed Gender Mainstreaming Activities (Target) 

Primary Responsibility 

Output 3: Performance-based road maintenance contracts are introduced. 

  Encourage equal representation by women and men maintenance supervisor positions 

appointed by DRBFC. 

  Ensure  participation  of  women  contractors  in  the  training  for  national  contractors  (at 

least 30% of female participants, and 30% of female facilitators). 

  Ensure training for national contractors incorporates modules on (i) women’s leadership 
in road construction, maintenance and safety; (ii) community-based road maintenance; 
and (iii) road safety for women, youth and school children. 

  Ensure women’s representation in leadership positions in  community-based groups (at 

least 30%). 
 

  Ensure  timing  for  routine  road  maintenance  and  skill  training  activities  adapts  to 

women’s and men’s daily working schedules. 

Output 4: Awareness of road safety and transport-related social issues will be increased. 

  Conduct baseline studies on gender-sensitive road safety awareness for different target 

groups in communities. 

  Ensure  safety  concerns  of  women,  youth,  children,  elderly  and  disabled  people  are 

incorporated in road safety education program. 

  Ensure road safety guidelines incorporate gender-sensitive HIV/AIDS and other sexually 

transmitted infections (STIs) prevention among construction workers and communities. 

  Ensure  gender-balanced  participation  (at  least  50%)  in  road  safety  and  HIV/AIDS 

education program.  

  Ensure  road  safety,  HIV/AIDS  education  programs  and  human  trafficking  awareness 
programs  in  communities  and  schools  include  female  facilitators  (50%),  use  various 
media, picture-based texts, local language and are sensitive to local culture. 

Output 5: Efficient project management

IMPLEMENTATION ARRANGEMENTS 

The CAFI will be the Executing Agency and the MPW will be the Implementing Agency of the project. The existing PMU 
will be responsible for a day-to-day project implementation. The GAP will be implemented by the PMU and will include 
one  full-time  national  SGDS  for  the  duration  of  project  implementation,  who  will  be  supervised  by  international  SGDS 
(intermittent).  The  national  and  International  specialists  will  be  responsible  for  the  overall  implementation  of  GAP 
including  incorporating  the  GAP  into  project  design,  planning,  implementation,  monitoring  and  evaluation,  capacity 
development, establishment and inclusion of sex-disaggregated data, gender sensitive indicators and analysis for project 
performance, monitoring, evaluation, and reporting. The progress of GAP activities will be included in regular progress 
reports on overall project activities submitted to ADB and the government. Other consultants (i.e., Capacity Development 
Specialist,  Communication and  Advocacy  Specialist)  or  women’s  organizations  and  NGOs  may  be  hired  to  implement 
different GAP activities under the guidance of the national and international SGDS. Gender Focal Person of MOI and of 
local authorities will also provide support for the GAP implementation. 

ADB  =  Asian  Development  Bank;  CAFI=  Conselho  de  Administracao  do  Fundo  Infraestrutura;  CAS  =  Communication 
and Advocacy; CDS = Capacity Development Specialist; DRBFC = Directorate of Road, Bridges and Flood Control; ES = 
Environmental  Specialist;  GFP  =  Gender  Focal  Person;  MPW  =  Ministry  of  Public  Works;  NGOs  =  non-governmental 
organization; PMU = Project Management Unit; RS = Resettlement Specialist; SGDS = Social, Gender and Development 
Specialist; Specialist.
